properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall is expected. Locations: Burin Peninsula to Connaigre. Total rainfall: possibly exceeding 50 mm. Time span: Wednesday evening until Thursday evening. Remarks: Periods of rain will develop on Wednesday evening and likely become heavy, at times, overnight. The rain is expected to taper off late on Thursday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-06T23:55:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-06T07:56:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3940581966.2020
Area: Burin Peninsula, Connaigre
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Village Of Macoun
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Village of Macoun. This advisory is for the Village of Macoun and for any individuals who may access water from the Macoun water system. This advisory is in effect until Wednesday October 14, 2020
Expires: 2020-10-14T12:00:00-06:00

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds gusting up to 80 km/h will develop Wednesday morning. A cold front passing through southern Ontario will bring strong, gusty winds beginning Wednesday morning. Winds will slowly diminish throughout the day. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-07T00:44:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-06T08:45:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3562901618.2020
Area: Simcoe - Delhi - Norfolk, Dunnville - Caledonia - Haldimand, Picton - Sandbanks Park, Midland - Coldwater - Orr Lake, Barrie - Collingwood - Hillsdale, Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County, Wingham - Blyth - Northern Huron County, Niagara Falls - Welland - Southern Niagara Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A disturbance intensifying near Southampton Island will bring strong winds and wet snow to the Sanirajak (Hall Beach) region. Easterly winds of 40 gusting to 60 km/h early this morning will increase throughout the day with gusts near 90 km/h developing later this afternoon. Northeasterly winds of 60 gusting to 90 km/h will persist for much of tonight before moderating slightly but remaining strong on Wednesday. The system will continue to weaken on Thursday with winds gradually diminishing into the 30 gusting to 50 km/h range by Thursday afternoon. In addition to the strong winds, wet snow and blowing snow will accompany this system. With surface temperatures hovering around the zero mark snowfall amounts will be difficult to predict as some of the precipitation will melt with ground contact. At this time total snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm are expected for today, tonight and Wednesday. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-07T00:30:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-06T08:31:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1442161222.2020
Area: Hall Beach
properties.Author: Environment Canada
